reviewText:
Early Access Review

At first glance, Hurtworld appears to be another cheap addition to Steam's already massive collection of Early Access survival games. Initially, I didn't pay it much mind, assuming that it would be quickly abandoned, like many other similar titles. However, after watching a few gameplay videos, Hurtworld caught my interest.

While I'll agree that Hurtworld's lack of originality is somewhat offputting, I believe it is fair to say that it is borrowing from the right places. It plays very similarly to Rust, another great survival game, but with tighter controls and combat mechanics. To put it simply, it feels like a refined first person shooter with major survival elements, whereas games like Rust are focused primarily on survival with the addition of slightly loose gun-based combat.

Aesthetically, Hurtworld is a decent looking game, though I can't say I'm a particularly big fan of the game's graphical style. The simplified art works wonders for optimization, putting it miles ahead of many Early Access survival titles in that regard. There is no music to be found, however, there are plenty of sound effects, most of which are crunchy and satisfying.

If you didn't already see this coming, I legitimately feel that Hurtworld is a diamond in the rough. While the game has not been in development for very long, and has its fair share of bugs and issues, there is plenty of fun to be had. If you are a fan of survival games and do not mind the Early Access program, I would certainly recommend picking up Hurtworld.
voteText: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Mad props to developers with the launch of this fun game!

It's got a simplistic design to it that does pack it's pro's and con's.. I don't shop around for too many games, but just like a lot of Alpha games that interest me, I think this one is going to stick.

If you are just picking this game up, expect it to be a grind in the beginning. Might be a little frustrating starting off but once you stick a good spawn/run you'll fall in love with the game over time.

The nice feature is that though it is a survival, it still allows you the opportunity for progression. You create tools which stay with you through death so you can start back off semi-comfortably, with the ability to spawn in your base toward mid to late game.

I love how killing other players carries the burden of potentially losing your items within a certain cooldown point, but I don't think that eliminates a good purge/bloodshed to seasoned players who have gained access to built storage units and bases. This can be tough for people who are just starting out as you do shed somewhat hard to come by resources if you're doing your best to throw together progression.

I think that the game could use a little TLC on building functions as some have exploited ways of securing plots of land with very little expenses, this could be a burden if you can't secure an area because of a floating platform above your head.

PRO:
-Gentle on graphics (though some might struggle with rain, though turning off luxury settings such as bloom/motion blur might fix this)
-keeping crucial items such as tools/weapons/bags/clothing
-The construction feature/menu is user-friendly allowing the not so talent to create beautiful structures
-More relying on hunting and less on scavanging for food
-Life necessities are tolerable (not having to deal with sore feet, bum knee, bad back, thirst)
-health UI is easy to read/manage

CON:
-Requirements of certain items can definitely be a grind
-No unarmed melee which leaves you defenseless when you are just starting out
-Just not enough resource spawns (maybe it is just me and it's reaching all out for hardcore survival, but in the end it is a game
-No Free-Look ability (this is huge for some as this is a feature contained in many games, not having it is definitely a step back)
-Nothing to benefit a moveable/reusable fire source for your average Nomad.

In the end you can see some of the CON's are luxury which might be brought in at a later time, I am content with where the game is right now.. It only goes to show through continued development and support, the sky is the limit.

I think I'm going to stick with this and see where it goes.

Please... For the love of God, add Free-Look.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a lot like Rust, except it has a playerbase that is thriving, and I think it's partially due to the friendliness of the entire game. This is honestly the first game that has Russians who won't kill on site, and the infamy system is great, all though it needs some tweaks.

With the infamy system, you get infamy for killing a player, and it generally lasts for 15 minutes per kill. However, regardless of who provokes the fight, the person who ends victorious will always get infamy. Basically, if I shoot you first, and you end up killing me, you get infamy and I get out scot free. If you die in this game, with no infamy, you drop nothing besides raw materials, which is basically anything that isn't clothes or crafted weapons. But if you are infamous when you die, you drop everything and you start from scratch. It's basically a reason to try to avoid killing as much as possible, resulting in the entire friendly atmosphere the game got.

Over all, I enjoy the game, and I feel as if people should give it a shot. It's very similar to Rust, except there is never a single person or group that dominates the server. No longer will you be killed by the top dogs of the server, but by only the elements and the vicious animals, and occasionally, people, who you have a chance to beat. This game will result in fantastic memories with friends and friendly people, and friends are to be made within the vast map of Hurtworld.

EDIT:
The only downside to this game is that, due to its early state, official servers will be often wiped to remove all old bases, and give new people a chance to dominate the server. So, a lot of wipes, and a lot of hacking. All though this game has people who hack, it's not an epidemic. Hacking can be fixed, it's just a matter of time. I bet 3 months from now, there will be less wipes, less hacks, and new items and updates to come. Greatest survival game I've ever played, I'd dare to say it's even better than Rust.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This review is based upon my current experiences with Hurtworld version 0.3.1.2

Even though I haven't played much yet, I already like the game a lot. It takes a lot of elements from legacy rust but does it better in some way. Gameplay is solid, no lags for me and its quite noob friendly since it has an infamy system which makes you drop more loot on death if you kill more players, therefore making it unattractive to kill new players. Its also easy to set up a private server using SteamCMD if you want to learn the game on your own before you jump in the online PvP action. I recommend this game to anyone who likes survival PvP games and some nice co-op action (Its a lot more fun if you play with a friend or friends). Devs are talking about a PvE setting for servers, so if you don't like PvP that much I would wait for PvE to come out first. Or you could always create a private server for you and your friends.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

** DISCLAIMER: This is based upon the Early Access, and extremely early at that one as well **

I've been craving a good survival-game for some time, because H1Z1, DayZ nor Arma 3: DayZ or Rust manages to fill my need for it, even though Rust are the closest at the moment.

We have gotten a huge ocean of survival \ crafting-games the past two years after the rising of the DayZ-mod.
People like it. People enjoy it. I like it. I enjoy it.
But after a while, all these tedious games kept popping up like candy, and while many of them barely touched the surface, some made it to the top, and are still staying there, even with the lack of content and quality it should have.

If a new survival game was to surface, it will need something special. Something extra. Something to make it stand out.
Subnautica for example. It's just another survival game. But it's under water. And it does it pretty well even without coop or multiplayer.

But, with this in mind, I just thought Meh
recommended: and while the game looks promising
hoursPlayed: the visuals and the devs seem to be up to pair with most of it.\n\nI played a total of 2 hours (1.9
voteText: since I did not want to surpass the refund-possibility)\n\nWhile the game looks nice enough with a slight Rust-feeling to it (Unity?)

50% off for example.
Adding more stuff to the game? Up it a notch. 40% off. Closing up to release? Only 10% off to make the last people jump on board to get that little discount before the release.

The main reason for me saying 'nay' to Hurtworld at the moment is primarily to the price-tag for offered content. Not because the lack of quality. I do like what I see

TL;DR: Looking for that new special survival game? This is not it - Yet.
Want to know if you should spend $15 on this? - Don't do it unless you're absolutely sure that you want to pay for a game that's very shallow in it's current state.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game picked up where Rust left off. Hurtworld does what Rust, and their team of second rate programmers couldn’t do in three years of development: produce a refined survival game with almost zero hackers.

With dedicated developers, native server side validation to prevent hackers, and excellent PvP, this is a top notch game destine to dethrone Rust as the top survival game. Whether you are deciding between this and Rust, or searching for a survival game, Hurtworld is a no-brainer.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I will obviously update this review more once I put more than 3 hrs into the game. From what I can tell already:

Pros:
-Awesome & helpful community. I went on to 4 different servers, and 4 different server communities helped me with some questions I had.
-Incredible dev team
-60fps (even on lower settings)
-Smooth mechanics
-Fun, engaging and downright addicting gameplay

Cons:
-Server issues (that dev team is working hard to fix/correct)
-Cheaters. This is expected in every MMO. *NOTE* dev team has already implemented ways to fix this. Seems to be effective thus far.

Conclusion:
-GET THIS GAME! It's super fun, awesome people/community and an excellent and caring dev team. Totally worth it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

New players looking for a complrehensive tutorial on how to get started in Hurtwold should find this video extremely helpful: https://youtu.be/LCwC3MQfz-U

It was made by a good friend of mine, and he deserves some credit for his hard work. Let me know what you think!

As far as my opinion on the game goes, it is definitely worth the money! It's still in a very early developmental stage so some things are quirky, or downright broken, but this is to be expected! If you a challenging survival title with tons of potential and low graphical requirements, then you should be pleased with Hurtworld. This game is like a blend of The Long Dark and Rust Legacy. 10/10 already, but still needs work (which is why it's Early Access)

Early Access Review

I can no longer recomend this game. What makes a game like this either thrive or die is the community around it and the community around this game for the english speaking folk like myself is just god awful.

I tried giving the game another go just the other day was greeted by many russians chinese and a few italians none of which could speak english. Bare in mind i was in a featured community server i did try a couple other servers but closest to a US base server i could find was split [EU/US] any thing else either had no players or had insane rates.

Trying to have a conversation was like speaking to a brick wall and trying to find people to play with was even more impossible. The game it's self doesn't seem to have changed much since when i bought it except now theres a build limit which is kind of lame.

Anyway stay away there are other survival games out there with more content and better communities.

They have added steamworkshop to this game but it only seems to have low-quality maps on it as of right now maybe check back in a year see how the game is then but as of right now i cant recomend it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As someone pretty new to survival games and honestly not expecting much.
I've just finished a 13 hour straight game and wouldn't have stopped if I didn't have work tomorrow.
Haven't laughed so much in a game for a while to be completely honest.


It starts out slow while you learn the basics of crafting and how to acquire ownership of land etc and when
you've figured all the little things out, you'll just not want to stop.

Met several people, some friendly some not so friendly, Nothing a spear couldn't fix.
had great fun sniping players, and hares with my little bow.

after a days work I managed to log out with a huge ♥♥♥ house, a garrage with a vehicle.
two shotguns and a load of other stuff.


EDIT: I really love this game and my review above should show that however there are some pretty blatant hackers around, atleast on the fullloot EU server I played. Just a heads up, check the servers a little before picking one you'll regret later.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\n12 hours in and i must say i am quite enjoying it... my first impressions were that it was much like a refined version of rust legacy and a much less toxic community... i got very lucky that the first people i ran into were super friendly and let me live with them, and not get kosd like a lot of people do... i still play with them and we are pretty good friends now... building a base is super hard if you're on your own, but getting c4 is a 1000x harder... so once your base is up, its probably up for good... and same with guns, they are super hard to come by, so enjoy all the classic bow and spear fights in the early game, they're tons of fun! once you do get that beautiful auto rifle though, DON'T LOSE IT! i lost the auto my friend gave to me to infamy, (a system to balance the game against bandits) we were super bummed out, but we grinded for that presious ore you need to make them... and it was tons of fun driving across the lands to get to the place we needed to mine it... thats another thing, cars! they're pretty sweet but also super hard to get the parts for... so make sure to keep it safe, or it will get stolen! anyways, my expeirence on this game has been great so far and everything seems fine, its well balanced, nicer people than rust, rare stuff is actually really rare for once, and its a grind that manages to hold your attention... 9/10 worth the $22.39 i paid for it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Easily one of the better early access games I have played in a long time. The beginning can be a little unforgiving since even the rain can contribute to killing you. But once you get a simple base going things start to move at a quick pace. the crafting system is easy to use and there are alot of options. And believe it or not the community (as far as I have seen) is one of the best I've come across, I have passed multiple players and I havent been killed! One even offered me assistance!

As long as the developers keep up with this game I believe this could be one of the top survival games on steam, My personal item additions would be a map, flashlight, and possibly some weapon attachments. Other than that this game is EASILY worth the $25 price tag.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hurtworld is a masterpiece in Alpha. Started on a new server and immediately meet up with a guy I don't know. We start surviving together and end up using Teamspeak to communicate. We die multiple times but end up finding a blown out base with all of the equipment to get geared. While staying at this place a group come along and try to kill me, but they got rekt in the end. My new friend and I end up grabbing all of our stuff and heading out to the rich land of winter. While on our escapade we start freezing to death and with no materials to make a fire. In the distance we see a base with a fire and end up running there for our lives. These kind people cautiously let us in to huddle around their fire (Had dynamite ready to throw in if they did not let us in), and when the sun rose my new friend and I went off on our adventure. Our adventure led us to the mountains of winter, where we found a poor fellow who had hollowed out a base. My new friend seeing he had no roof jumped in and killed him. Our adventures now had gifted us with a new base that we've re-construced into a mega base. This game is great, and has only just begun in Alpha; I can't imagine what the developers will throw in next.

TL;DR: Always put a roof on your house or a white guy will jump in and kill you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hurtworld is a masterpiece in Alpha. Started on a new server and immediately meet up with a guy I don't know. We start surviving together and end up using Teamspeak to communicate. We die multiple times but end up finding a blown out base with all of the equipment to get geared. While staying at this place a group come along and try to kill me, but they got rekt in the end. My new friend and I end up grabbing all of our stuff and heading out to the rich land of winter. While on our escapade we start freezing to death and with no materials to make a fire. In the distance we see a base with a fire and end up running there for our lives. These kind people cautiously let us in to huddle around their fire (Had dynamite ready to throw in if they did not let us in), and when the sun rose my new friend and I went off on our adventure. Our adventure led us to the mountains of winter, where we found a poor fellow who had hollowed out a base. My new friend seeing he had no roof jumped in and killed him. Our adventures now had gifted us with a new base that we've re-construced into a mega base. This game is great, and has only just begun in Alpha; I can't imagine what the developers will throw in next.

TL;DR: Always put a roof on your house or a white guy will jump in and kill you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has already ruined my life faster than World of Warcraft (my most played game) ever did/could. This game is pretty fantastic for being in early access, and it's super addicting. So far I've built a base with some friends, got some weapons, did some raids on a guy who killed us when we started fresh, nearly lost my girl friend, stopped hanging out with my RL friends, destroyed my sleep schedule, and pondered finishing college. Sad yes, but if that doesn't tell you that you should probably buy this game then I'm not sure what will.

This game has interesting graphics, helps others who can't afford super computers for games like Ark be able to play. Gameplay is pretty smooth, and even once you know where everything is it can still be a challenge to obtain specific items. I personally don't have any game-breaking problems, maybe very little latency issues, but other than that the devs have stated they want to fix current bugs before adding more features to the game, which is a good thing im my opinion. Highly recommend this to anyone who likes PvP Survival games.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Kinda like rust, but its better in a lot of ways. And it actually has VEHICLES! (only like 2)
But there are a LOT of glitches to fix.
For example, animals often walk through walls and attack you through your house.
And you get heatstrokes when near a fire, either though if the fire is outside NEXT to a house that your in, you still get heatstrokes which is quite annoying, and the only way to survive heatstrokes is to run away from the fire and there is NO cooling system. I admit, there are a ton of bugs that are quite annoying, and good servers are also hard to find.
But the good sort of out weighs the good. I reccomend this game, but I'd suggest probably suggest you wait till the bugs are fixed. Hopefully the devs will be on that.
Other than the bad stuff, it's a really awesome game.

Early Access Review

Do not compare it to Rust, it is it's own game.

Overall it's a good game that with some time, will have plenty of content and will be very well polish which it currently is for an early access game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI honestly don't know why this game been getting hated on recently. I know that I do not have very much playtime compared to some of the other reviewers, but I find this game extremely fun. It is relatively bug-free, and it is fairly easy to find an occupied server to connect to. There does seem to be a drop in the amount of official servers recently, but there are plenty of great community servers as well. I have yet to find any hackers, and this game has a very friendly community, especially when compared to other survival games, where you are guaranteed to be killed on sight, no matter what. There is an ever-expanding base building system that always seems to improve, allowing for more unique bases, and I find that extremely fun, as it gives players a reason to create bases that are nearly impossible to raid, yet it is also fun to try to find a way to raid differently designed bases. While this game is not completely perfect, it is still in Alpha, so I feel that it is deserving of an 8/10 for now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

PART 1

So this is what happened to me in the past 14 hours I've played.
The first thing I do is join a server all servers were full so I decided to join a chinease server I spawn get loot soon build a small hut. Then after an hour I want to adventure i adventure into the pine tree biome. (I don't know the name of it) When I get there I meet this friendly man it seemed he only muttered small english words like come, stay, eat, etc. very small words but I soon trust him he takes me into his house and then I see it's unfinished, so I say I can help you and he swears some words into his mic (Of some other language) that I don't understand. He then screams and yells and pulls a bow out I soon panic and run around his base he then catches up to me and says bye *psh* I'm struck by  an arrow in the head..In anger I rage quit.

PART 2

I then go on to a sydney server I spawn gather wood and flint made a flint axe I then run into a fellow player he doesn't talk I continue to communicate to him no voice or typing I then stab him to dead and laugh at the ragdoll effect. *Psh*a arrow misses me by very very little and I see it fly by my face. I then zig zag like I'm crazy go up to where the guy was shooting. I then scream Hahaha you suck ♥♥♥ at shooting dude" he looks at me. We stare for moments then he puts his head down and said he was using me as target practice we then chat I say do you want to join my army he denies and says "I'm in a clan" I then ask to join he says you have to talk to my leader HITLER....I then follow him to his base we meet the mighty australian hitler and I join his clan. We then have nice adventures togethe we made houses for noobs with materials WE gathered nobody else's. We build the houses befriend many people. Then the man danny comes on I notice he has a rifle..A very shiny rifle my eyes widen I'm shocked to see someone with a gun of such beauty. We talk then go on a mining trip to the snow to get materials (10-20 minute walk from our base). We go back then a man aproaches us and says "Do you guys have iron" the mans name was Divine he was with a man that's name broke my ears...BARRY!!! The same man I killed in the beggining. I hold my mighty spear Galiothe up in the air I then swear at the gentlmen and danny replied to them "Yeah we have some do you want to trade" they say yes We ask of the red ore (I forget it's name) but we agreed two stacks for 150 iron. (Yes I know very stupid not asking for a specific number but we needed the ore) He agrees then says he'll be back in 15 minutes he messeges me "I want this to guy by smooth! No shady ♥♥♥♥ and we do it in an open field nobody on the hillside no weapons" I agree he comes back we go in the open field and I drop the iron and barry drops the ore...I then hear divine yell "RUN BARRY RUUUUN" I look in my inventory and see we only got SIX green ore. I pull out my bow and start shooting I yell to the others "COME HERE NOW" they come ask what happen and I say in a mad voice "Nothing.." I then hand the ore to danny he takes it. Hitler keeps asking "What happened dude what happened did we get the stuff" I say "Ask danny". We then go out for materials I go for wood danny stays home and hitler hunts. I go on a killing spree and kill 3 nakeds when I got back I tried opening the door. It was locked....I wondered how could it be locked and I yell many times "Danny
recommended:
let me in dude let me the ♥♥♥♥ in!!!" He opens the door I say thanks dude I notice in slow motion in my mind danny has his rifle out..I then look at him *BAM* I'm shot in the balls and have fallin on my back. I yell into the mic "why danny whyyyy?!?!?!?!?" *BAM* another gunshot goes and I respawn. Hitler goes back to the base after hunting and tries to open the door he danny opens the door then *BAM* it says in chat that hitlers been killed by danny in shock I rage. I run to the house and hitler comes with another guy we try to break the wall down we spent 10 minutes trying. (you can't break the walls) We soon give up and move into one of the houses we built for the noobs.

PART 3

After protesting at danny's new home (our old one) for an hour we then choose to build up our base to the max and get C4 to blow up our old house. After gathering I soon go to bed. When I wake up I turn on my computer and play Hurtworld hitlers still up by drinking red bull for the past 6 hours I've been sleep. I spawn in where I last was here shouting. 4 dudes were outside our house they were yelling at us. I go back in the house to get my arrows then one rushes in while i opened the door I close it and say "Get out dude" he refuses and keeps running in circles he kills hitler. Hitler before he died accidently took the ownership claim out. We 1v1 each other then it ends like my previous server. A arrow to the face. I spawn at regular spawn run to the old base then I see it's gone because they guy must of deleted it and took all our loot..I cared but didn't care hitler then goes off to the snow then builds..not telling where we built but while he was over there I was chilling with danny he makes me a Rifle such as his the beauty it was. I still have it at the time of me writing this. But we soon became friends with danny again and we chill with each other now.

END (Tells the score this game got)

This is by far the best survival game to me out there. You can do so much and chill with people at the campfire people will just come up and be like can I be here and warm up. This game has brought non stop joy and fun to me for the past 14 hours I've played so far this game is a amazing 10/10 game and runs so smoothly no frame rate drops amazing performance and overall an actual hardcore survival game I do refer this to many other players buy it now while it's on sale but it's definietly worth it's retail price."

HEY GUYS!   if you want to buy this game you should read this facts about it:


first....this is a hardcore survival..that means you have to eat....you have to be warm everytime...etc
the game is very good optimized...60 fps all graphics at the highest
nice graphic style.....named it team fortress 2:D
in general most of the players are friendly:)
a lot of gameplay..so you can enjoy it with your friends...like chillin' in the desert....eating some steaks:)

the devs are really really cool...they are listening to the fan base...and updating the game very often:D
you can drive cars..yes u heard that..if you are a racing games fanand a survival games fan this game is made for you:)



cons=the official servers(for EU players) are crap...i'll recommend you to play on community servers..less lag..kits..tpa...etc.  (if you are searching for some really good servers i'll recommend you DARKWORLD and TURDWORLD....this servers are very good....more loot very friendly stuff,kits,tpa.


hope i helped you with the game...buy it..You wouldn't regret it!:D     PEACE

NPC AI = o.O

Game needs improvements.


Pros

Cons

-Few players on servers
-Few items to craft


If you find this game on a discount, and if they improve the game you should try and buy this, but right now there are other alternatives like Rust or Ark.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

-The building system is becoming more and more robust with every passing month, and allows you to be more creative with your structures (already far more so than other early access titles in the same genre). From building a giant Gothic style cathedral on a plateau to a sprawling chateu in the desert, the new building system is largely underrated.

-Hurtworld is a highly stylized game, almost TF2 esque. Which means it shouldn't seem dated anytime soon.

-Devs are always in touch with the community they've created.

-The PvE aspect is very much prominent, making it more of a survival against the wilderness and hunger rather than other players. I haven't found many players who KOS in Hurtworld (Sure, you'll come across an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ here and there, but not as many as in other early access survival games).

-Infamous system is great, and makes you think twice before you go hunting your fellow humans.

-There are a handful of bugs you'll find on your journey from start to endgame, but none will come close to ruining your gameplay experience.

-The crafting and sorting/splitting system could use some work, and the mob AI could be (and probably will be) improved.

-In my opinion, Hurtworld is best enjoyed with a group of friends. Playing alone can be a grind but still enjoyable nonetheless.

-Do not take if you are nursing, pregnant, or may become pregnant.

-If you have an erection lasting longer than 4 hours, do not take Hurtworld without some sweet hussies by your side.

Hurtworld is definitely heading in the right direction. Most reviews I've seen have been way off point, considering that Hurtworld is not a fully released title. The playerbase has dwindled quite a bit, but you can still enjoy Hurtworld on a handful of very populated servers. Hopefully the Steam store announces Hurtworld's official release, because it's not an experience you'll want to miss.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nOnce again, we have a survival game with great crafting, building, deep survival, and a terrible terrible community. Spawn, die, spawn, die, spawn, die. This is essentially the formula. The saving grace here that sets Hurtworld apart from Rust and H1Z1 is that you respawn with your tools and weapons you had when you died. This definitely helps, so you arent starting over from scratch every time. At the end of the day however, its simply another kill on sight, spawn and die, rinse and repeat survival game. The worst enemy, as always, are other players who simply do not care. Prepare to die over and over again. Inch a little further, and die again. If you are okay with this, go right ahead. If your'e sick of this formula as I am, sick of a game turning you and others into ruthless killing machines who kill other players and loot them for no reason, then move along. Nothing to see here.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At first glance, Hurtworld appears to be another cheap addition to Steam's already massive collection of Early Access survival games. Initially, I didn't pay it much mind, assuming that it would be quickly abandoned, like many other similar titles. However, after watching a few gameplay videos, Hurtworld caught my interest.

While I'll agree that Hurtworld's lack of originality is somewhat offputting, I believe it is fair to say that it is borrowing from the right places. It plays very similarly to Rust, another great survival game, but with tighter controls and combat mechanics. To put it simply, it feels like a refined first person shooter with major survival elements, whereas games like Rust are focused primarily on survival with the addition of  gun-based combat.

Moving to Hurtworld's surprisingly large selection of features, all the action takes place on a relatively small map. Unlike Rust, Hurtworld's equipment system is split more precisely into item tiers, similar to those find in other games such as Minecraft and Terraria.
Aesthetically, Hurtworld is a decent looking game, though I can't say I'm a particularly big fan of the game's graphical style. The simplified art works wonders for optimization, putting it miles ahead of many Early Access survival titles in a sense. There is no music to be found, however, there are plenty of sound effects, most of which are sadly just poor but funny voice acting.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What a gem. This is a throwback in some sense to my experience with the original Savage: The Battle for Newerth, the FPS mechanics and aesthetic of the environment and everything is just-as if not more fresh, especially with the TF2-style cell shading, and the absence of the Zombie Apoc fanservice, which is really what I've been waiting for before jumping on the survival sim bandwagon. The game itself and multi-player is relatively smooth, requires low-system resources, also one of the ideas I've had, have semi-ownable property which can only be destructable with very expensive temporary items, all of this already beautifully implemented. Game hasn't been out for very long and it's already made of gold (and it shows from the sharp spike in playercount just as it's getting off the ground).

You people win a Yetti dipped in gold.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is... This game is... SIMPLY BEAUTIFUL. \ Similar to RUST //

PROS
- The game run perfeclty so well on HIGH and LOW computer spec. A laptop can do the job at 30 FPS approx.
- All the system: Craft, loot, when you die you keep your tools, spawning, map area divided in 4 section I believe etc.
- Graphic look's: Cartoon. I actually prefer this type of graphic instead of realistic stuff for these games.
- The fact that you never know when a player/ or raiding group will trap you and destruct your work.
- PLAYING WITH YOUR FRIENDS IS MAGICAL!
- Low sized fil on your drive, approx: 1-2Gb.
- Pretty easy to learn for anyone in a short period of time.
- Choose your server = Choose your language and style of play. Intense PvP or survival stuff.

CONS (More like things to work on and Idea)
- When you use a bow, you can get back your arrow on the mob/wall or anything after shooting. Could be implemented!
- Hard to find your friend, maybe implement a totem friend group thing or a compass friend thing or a group system.
- Actually a map, crafting map, or something. **Not quite sur if an Item like that exist. I should double check**
- Maybe delete the flying house and object flying system and create a ULTRA BUNKER thing that can't be destroy or something like that to prevent the flying stuff.
- Create a GUILD/CREW system for PvPing player and give more importance with the totem (Ownership stake).

SO, guys, you should totally take this game WITHOUT QUESTIONING if you are looking for a game to be played with FRIENDS. In solo, I think this game can be really frustrating but you meet and speak with a tone of player so keep in mind TO ACTIVATE AND DON'T BE SHY TO USE YOUR MICROPHONE or you'll get kill for no reason. Good luck guys and just give it a try and push your friends so they could play with you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've spent nearly 20 hours building a single, moderately sized base. You read in the description that once you've established yourself, survival is no longer trivial -- that's 100% true. The slightest miscalculation or slip-up could cost me 30 mintues worth of farming resources, or 20 hours of constructing a home. This is one of the only open world, survival games on steam where PVE is more challenging than PVP. If you want a game where you can get geared up, raid, and fight other players in little time, this is not the game for you (H1Z1, DayZ mod, etc).

The community is great. Sure, there will be many players who aim to kill on sight, in Hurtworld's hardcore environment you can hardly blame them. Though, if you are patient and willing to reason, you will find there are many other players interested in becoming an ally.

Visually the graphics are very appealing. They are sharp and vibrant. This game isn't very demanding so most PCs can run it.

I rate 10/10

Edit: I play on the official New York #6 server. You'll find the same players on the same server if you play often enough. Hope to see some new players!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has potential to be great.

I'm only 4.5 hours in, as of typing out this review, and the game has already grown on me. In terms of environmental variety the game definitely lacks, however, since it's in Alpha most of the lacking features make sense. I'll judge the game on what we have right now.

You wake up in a desert with nothing but shorts. You're naked, helpless and by the time night falls you have two options - it's either you prepare a campfire or simply die trying. The first day and spawn can be rough for a newcomer but surviving through that gives you the momentum to...uh..well survive.

This review is in progress (just like the game) and will be updated when I've delved more into this world of hurt.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nGreat game, I only have 2 complaints, 1 of which has already been slightly fixed, The one that has been fixed is that drills were and sort of still are too OP, people just get a few drills going and sit on their porch sniping at people. They made drills slightly less effective which made me happy but further drill nerfing is needed. The other complaint that hasn't been addressed yet is the lack of loot in-game. Sure I understand that C4 needs to be hard to make and I appreciate how hard it is to raid everyone. But I have even gone into loot areas on servers with NOBODY only to find that there was 1 box there and all it contained was 7 bullets. Not to mention that I never see any cars being driven around which means that I'm not the only one having no luck finding fun loot. All in all I have read some things the devs have to say and I really like them. And the best part of all that this game has that makes it a 9/10 is that YOU DON'T LOSE EVERYTHING UPON DEATH!!! Halle♥♥♥♥inglujah. But devs PLEASE do more with infamy, KOS players must be punished and nerfing the effects of infamy isnt helping that cause. I understand that if 1 person is defending himself and takes out a few guys and gets killed by the 4th he should not lose more stuff, but come up with something, I have faith in you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Game

Hurtworld is a nice survival based game. The game a lot of materials, craftings and other challenging things in it.
You can play on official and community servers with your friends and the game is a PvE PvP based game.
The game is like rust but developers will improve the game with uptades.

Pros;

-The game has a great PvP and PvE system.
-The game is a good survival game.
-The game has a great and a large map with structures on it like containers.
-The game also contains a lot of crafting.

Cons;

-The game needs some bug fixes.
-The game needs some optimization.
-Some servers might lag.
-Game needs more active developers.

Anyway at all, the game is a great game. You will not have any problem and the game is also
really easy to understand. You will need to read the wikia of the game at some points where you will need to find some valuable stuff to make you better at the game and those things are not that hard to find too. After reading the game wikia for 10-20 minutes you will understand that it is a really easy game to play.

I recommend the game to everybody and also gamers
that like survival based games. Also you need a good computer.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nVery good game. Survival at it's best. Hard to get vehicle parts. I hope they make it easier for you to get parts, add more mobs, and more loot to the mobs. Overall a great game and a great experience. I played with a friend for a few hours and it was fun, but to really get a good multiplayer experience have at least 2 other buddies with you. I don't have friends that play this game, and people will kill you and never say a word to you, so i didn't really get to experience the true value of this game, I feel like. If you're looking for a survival game that has atleast 15-20 hours of gameplay this game is right for you. More gameplay if you have friends that play.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A decent survival sandbox game with great potential. Fun to play with friends.

PROS:

- Engrossing (you might not notice sinking 20 or more hours into the game)
- Not heavy on the GPU/CPU
- Mostly friendly community (make sure to start talking if you see somebody and try to make friends with him)


CONS:

- Not much content and mechanics at the moment (game is 1 month old)
- Stutters from time to time even on a powerful PC
- Animal AI needs some working on
- UI could use some love too

SUBJECTIVE:

- You retain certain items on death (such as tools and clothes)
- Cartoonish visuals

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Right Now My Most Favorite Game.

Since I am Bored In Class, I decided to make a review.

------------------------------------

First Impressions (Sorry if Short):

For $20 USA - THIS game. Is worth every lenny penny.

The frame rate you can get in the game is great. The gunplay is great. Crafting, etc. There is so much to do and explore in this game atm... AND VEHICLES!!! I love the vehicles in this game, great for making runs to grab supplies and other things.
------------------------------------
My First Time Joining A Server:

I joined a server called Hurt Time, it is on the nodded server list. I am the type of person who likes starter kits. I got the starter kit and the starter kit was not OP at all. It was very balanced. (Not a Server Review...)

I walked around with my pick and axe chopping and mining everything in sight. Next thing you know, *Gunshot*, I WAS SCARED ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. I spent 45 minutes gathering, thinking I was about to die. I see him... He comes up to me. (PLZ DON'T Kill Me I thought in my Head)
All he said was: Hii" And walked away... (Heavily Breathing) I looked at him and said hi back. This was the start of a friendship with the Tuskans
date:
one of the  giant groups on the fairly populated server.
------------------------------------

This Game definitely has some trolls. Nice People
recommended:
♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. But I already love it.

I would rate this game 5 Stars
☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆
Another Thing You Might want to know is that this game is VERY. I MEAN. VERY. GRINDY. My friends on the server has about 70 hours already and they say they are no where near bored
hoursPlayed:
and not even 1/2 way near endgame. It just shows that this game has content.
☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆

I hope you enjoyed my review!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Bought the game thought it was pretty cool, thought i was gonna refund it for some reason. Backed out of the game and when i saw my hours i was like, holy ♥♥♥♥ i thought i was on for 20mins

Lets Be Real

This game is ♥♥♥♥ING AMAZING, i buy and play a lot of survival games like rust, dayz, 7 dayz to die, h1z1. and more but refunded some just because of how bad they were in development. THIS GAME on the other hand already runs at 60fps for me and im on a 2gb card, it also has a ♥♥♥♥ ton to work for. People may say it dosent but i find it pretty damn hard to set up a base and keep people away from it, late at night almost ever night il have people from who knows were come and ask if they can sit by my fire for the night. The community is not salty, theres a lot of amazing people. For example when i first was building my house i got 1 guy to help me out then 2 guys then 3 and soon i relized i had built my house in a little town of 5 people who would check on me everyday to make sure i was ok, we now start a farm of fruites and work together to survive. this game is a ton of fun with or without friends and i highly recommend this game to any fan of survival. Now i could go on about ever little detail but this is long enough as it is, just buy the god damn game while its $5 off, and good luck.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is extremely fun at first, when you're experiencing everything for the first time. Once you've reached the end-game stage, the main things to do are PvP and Raid. Raiding is extremely hard to do and requires a large amount of resources so you don't typically raid someone unless you know they're very rich or you have a personal vendetta against them. PvP is somewhat pointless as in it's rare you gain anything from it.

In order to get someones weapon (The main thing you're usually going to want when killing someone for their loot) they need to have Infamy which means they need to have killed someone recently and even then there's only a chance you get their gun as there's a chance it will drop their clothing or tools over the gun. In my opinion, raiding is not worth the resources so I stick to PvP but it is not rewarding either, unless you play Full-Loot servers. In Full-Loot servers you drop every item on your player when you die, the problem is that most of the community is too worried about losing one item, never mind their entire inventory so the Full-Loot servers are pretty much dead at all times.

One more issue is becuase of the lacking of towns and specific pvp areas,  people tend to pvp around the spawn points which puts new players at a huge disadvantage, they cannot defend themselves. A large amount of people like to build large towers and snipe out of little holes so it's hard for players to fight back and if they die, their loot drops into their base (Reassuring them they won't even lose a single item). Makes for a terrible PvP experience.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TL;DR: Raiding will typically make you use more resources then you will gain, whereas PvP will have you gain nothing unless you're lucky. Game is fun to play until you reach the End Game stage; the stage you're working towards but find out is not what you were hoping for. Just like most internet communitys this one has a very toxic one, some players do whatever they can to ensure they have the advantage; even if it means ruining pvp for everyone else.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Been playing this game for 17 hours now, in 2 sittings. Its addictive as hell! You should play it with atleast one friend (we're currently a team of 4, tearing ♥♥♥♥ up)

The game is really nice even though its in alpha/beta. There are bugs here and there but overall its functioning and well worth buying. I see lots of potential for this game, there are so many things they can add and change.

The PvE is really fun, you need to gather resources in order to build your base. I would however hope to see more resources and building options in the future, roofs for example (using floors works fine for the most part). But as I said its in alpha/beta.

The PvP is awesome. U need to gather lots of resources before you can take on the dudes who's carrying assault rifles or shotguns, unless u'r really skilled and sneaky. The game allows for lots of strategy and you constantly learn new stuff. In order to raid other peoples bases you need explovies, which are really expensive to make. Or you camp outside their base and kill em while the door is open and hope they don't have double doors.

Overall its cool, it's got basic graphics and physics but the overall feel of the game is really neat. Looking forward to seeing what this game will turn into in the future.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Reminds me of the great rust legacy days which is great!

Some things i like about this game are:
#Great sense of survival (you pretty much always have to find a heat source at night to survive)
#Very well optimized, so far in my fEw hours of gameplay i have encountered no game breaking bugs.
#Animations for an EA game are pretty cool especially on the animals
#NO SLEEPERS!!!
#The loot you lose depends on how you treat other players if you KOS everyone when you die you lose pretty much all your gear where as friendly players will only lose resources such as wood or stone and not their tools they have crafted. so if you get killed whilst innocently gathering things you are not going to lose all your progress instantly
#not very easy to get guns everyone i have met even if they have a big base are using weapons such as spears and bows.
#The harsh survival element of the game encourages people to work together a bit more and you dont have to eat every 30 seconds (could be better but still its not as bad as some other survival games.

so far i have only put a few hours in but i feel this game deserves a recomendation as it has released flawlessly with no issues joining servers and always having plenty of full servers to join. Im looking forward to future updates as in its very early state right now it has a fair amount of content to be getting on with already.

conclusion?

10/10 would be robbed again.. twice :D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

### Read and Agree If You Like What You See ###


Pro's:

* Decent Graphics ( TF2 graphics, but thats the charm ! )
* Sandbox, building, surviving, making clothes, making weapons / tools
* Building a base - ♥♥♥♥♥♥ outdoor toilet or a big castle !
* Gathering resources, searching for parts to build ATV / Buggy vehicle
* Different biomes
* Big World
* Hostile animals
* No Zombies
* Changing Enviroment ( e.g Rain, Sandstorm etc )
* Uninstall doesn't work  ( irony )

Cons:

* Still thinking about to write here.


Note: My first base, took me about 3-4 hours to build. Solid I thought. Big and all as well. Had a half hour break, got back and all I could see was a leftover meat in the fridge.

- Would eat leftovers again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok so this is a very early access review and opinions I have expressed here may change. Hurtworld is very much like RUST. The graphics are relatively similiar and the game plays out similiar.

However this game is very much better than RUST for a number of reasons.
>The community is at this moment nowhere near as toxic. You can happily have conversations with new spawns or even people who can kill you and take all your stuff without you being able to do a thing about it.
> I haven't played RUST in a while but the crafting system in this game comes across a lot better to me. It tells you the recipe clearly and easy to get the hang of.
> The qwerty graphics are very nice and clean. They make the game have a unique feel depsite being a very similiar sandbox survival to RUST.
> The game took me around 3 minutes to install with the download being next to none but the content relatively large.

As this game is in Alpha and only just released hopefully some DEV's see this and can make improvements. These below are all points for improvement, they may be percieved as negative but considering how early this game is into development It is in its current stage very good.
>Add more content - The game itself requires a real grind but when you have M4's and a car and so many resources there isn't anything to play for. I turned to raiding even though it goes against an earlier comment, I did because I could.
>The map itself is relatively small for a sandbox survival, as soon as you hit the desert or far reaches of the polar biome which is surprisingly small you can go no further. The map in my opinion needs to be bigger and given actual towns and more biomes at least.
>Expanding on a previous point and perhaps my most contraversial (R.I.P English) a bigger map would provide more space for vehicles and a stronger variety. Personally I would like to see Aeroplanes. I may be alone at this point but the idea of making a base with a runway or helipad appeals to me. Also a large map, travelling to other parts of an expansive map seems incredible.
> I would like to see more animals and more threats. Sasquatches are not much of a threat and with an M4 easy to kill. Even a Yeti provides no challenge against 2 players with a gun or even a hunting bow. Perhaps add more animals such as lions etc. A big threat yet providing reward for people who kill them. Animals on any level would be appreciated.
> My one complaint will be deer's... They attack you proving no threat whatsoever but Deer's would never attack a human I don't understand why they are so aggressive. Stupid but valid.

In general I have spent around 25 hours on this game and have already enjoyed some great moments. I did run out of things to do but that can be expected in a game within such early stages. I am very excited to see what the DEV's do with this game and where they take it. I hope some people can agree with my aeroplanes point. Regardless lets just hope the devs stay active and add more variety to an already decent game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

HURTWORLD.


Hurtworld is a very good game, but sadly without potential. This game is a simple copy and paste of rust, but i need to say that some things in this game are made better than in rust. Firstly, this game have better community than rust, and theres no cheaters. Secondly, this game is survival, not dumb p v p in which everyone want just raid other bases and kill other players. In this game its really hard to survive, weapons are really hard to get, but they are very good, so its profitable to make them. In Hurtworld, we need also to build base fast, otherwise we will get heatstroke (if living on desert) or we will just freeze (if living in winter biome). Same thing with clothes, thanks to hats you wont get heatstroke, and thanks to jackets you wont freeze.

How do I rate the game?
(+)
+ Community/no cheaters
+ Graphics other than in other games.
+ This game has been related 2 weeks ago and it have less bugs/glitches than alot of other games that have been related long time ago.
+ It's impossible to get bored with this game.
+ Hardcore survival
(-)
- Only 4 types of ranged weapons. (Assault rifle semi, Assault rifle auto, Rifle, Shotgun)
- Theres only few types of creatures.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Overall rating: 3,9 / 5

Theres alot of things which this game needs, but lets dont forget that this game is still alpha. I highly recommend this game, for people that likes survival games.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok so this is a very early access review and opinions I have expressed here may change. Hurtworld is very much like RUST. The graphics are relatively similiar and the game plays out similiar.

However this game is very much better than RUST for a number of reasons.
>The community is at this moment nowhere near as toxic. You can happily have conversations with new spawns or even people who can kill you and take all your stuff without you being able to do a thing about it.
> I haven't played RUST in a while but the crafting system in this game comes across a lot better to me. It tells you the recipe clearly and easy to get the hang of.
> The qwerty graphics are very nice and clean. They make the game have a unique feel depsite being a very similiar sandbox survival to RUST.
> The game took me around 3 minutes to install with the download being next to none but the content relatively large.

As this game is in Alpha and only just released hopefully some DEV's see this and can make improvements. These below are all points for improvement, they may be percieved as negative but considering how early this game is into development It is in its current stage very good.
>Add more content - The game itself requires a real grind but when you have M4's and a car and so many resources there isn't anything to play for. I turned to raiding even though it goes against an earlier comment, I did because I could.
>The map itself is relatively small for a sandbox survival, as soon as you hit the desert or far reaches of the polar biome which is surprisingly small you can go no further. The map in my opinion needs to be bigger and given actual towns and more biomes at least.
>Expanding on a previous point and perhaps my most contraversial (R.I.P English) a bigger map would provide more space for vehicles and a stronger variety. Personally I would like to see Aeroplanes. I may be alone at this point but the idea of making a base with a runway or helipad appeals to me. Also a large map, travelling to other parts of an expansive map seems incredible.
> I would like to see more animals and more threats. Sasquatches are not much of a threat and with an M4 easy to kill. Even a Yeti provides no challenge against 2 players with a gun or even a hunting bow. Perhaps add more animals such as lions etc. A big threat yet providing reward for people who kill them. Animals on any level would be appreciated.
> My one complaint will be deer's... They attack you proving no threat whatsoever but Deer's would never attack a human I don't understand why they are so aggressive. Stupid but valid.

In general I have spent around 25 hours on this game and have already enjoyed some great moments. I did run out of things to do but that can be expected in a game within such early stages. I am very excited to see what the DEV's do with this game and where they take it. I hope some people can agree with my aeroplanes point. Regardless lets just hope the devs stay active and add more variety to an already decent game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm loving this game, but Hurtworld needs more content.
I understand this game is Early Access, and it's a great game because of that. Yet, I do hope the developers do not abandon this title, because there is not enough content for the price tag.
The true fun of this game appears when you are wallowing around with your friends, and a gunfight sprouts from the dunes. Cars are a lot of fun, just get ready to grind for the parts...and grind for everything else.
Base building is a lot of fun in my opinion, and the great thing, it can only be destroyed by C4 (the hardest thing in the game to get). I advise you do not trust naked men on the side of the road to go in your house. They will steal everything you have.
You will die in this pretty but plain world. Thankfully, you do not lose your tools you spent hours grinding for to create. You only lose the items you use to build these tools... Tread cautiously, friends.
I will continue to play this game, and I thank my companion for buying it for me. Just remember: This is Hurtworld. Not...Softworld? You get the picture.  8/10
-Walrus

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game was pretty fun until the community died. Now a clan of 4 or 5 people can pretty much take over a server because there aren't enough people playing. The game has a lot of potential but in its current state, it's definitely not worth it.

Devs don't update the game enough. By the time updates do come out, players have already lost the hype.
There is only one map so exploring gets boring quickly, and the way it's designed makes it incredibly easy for people to camp the noobie area. I've seen way too many new players ragequit in their first day because some group living near the spawn area finds them every few minutes and kills them. I know being killed is part of any survival game, but I find the way this game has it set up just makes it so much worse for new players.
Once you do get off your feet, you realize there just isn't enough content to keep you interested. Imo the main thing that kept people playing was the community but sincemost servers are nearly empty nowadays, there's nothing left to work for.

Honestly, the only thing that stands out about this game compared to other popular ones are the cars, but cars aren't worth spending nearly $30.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe game started pretty bare, but over time has added some neat festures that make it different from others. I like how transparent the devs are about what they are working on and the issues they may face which allow players versed in Unity to chime in to help out. The fact it is done in Unity and is now workshop should allow more workshop items and make it fairly easy to create asstes for the game. Since the workshop update there are a handful of cool user made maps, and I am sure there is more to come. If you are worried about balance they are always working on that to make the best gameplay experience. I mostly play on a role playing server with a custom map and love it. Keep in mind that it is still early access with wipes that happen, look at it as a way to start over with new items and tools to play better than before. We have done bases in all enviornments and types, and love the change.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

INTRO Hurtworld is similar to the other open world survival games on the market, but in it's own unique way is completley different.

PROS - Survival aspect is just hard enough without punishing new players
- PvP in the newby areas is mainly consistant of bow & arrows and spears while gun pvp is mainly found in the higher leveled areas
- When you die you keep your items, this means that there isnt a constant grind every time you die

CONS - Its Early Access so there are bugs
- People are just as unfriendly as ever and are willing to KOS you for no reason (although this is more a point for all survival games not just this one)
- The hypothermia system is pretty hardcore
- There isn't any way to lock your door so logging off with all your goods inside can be really dangerous

CONCLUSION All in all Hurtworld is a pretty well paced, enjoyable survival game. Unlike some other games on the market *cough* *cough* rust, the game doesn't heavily favour groups and punish solo players, its also a lot more forgiving in its survival mechanics but they can still kill you if you dont manage your warmth and food supply well enough. I'd say its worth the $19.99 asking price as the devs seem dedicated to actually fleshing this out into a full game unlike other developers *cough* *cough* DayZ.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game started out great, and in fact is still a fun game however there is a major problem with it...

Official server is plagued by cheaters/glitchers meaning that all your hardwork put into building bases and crafting items (which sometimes can take days since building requires an almost unnecesary amount of resources) are in risk of being taken from you without giving you a chance to fight back. The developers will not aid you if this happens and you are just S.O.L.

Non official servers do have more active admins, however if you are an english speaking player in america you will only find servers (with players) that get away from the intended gameplay meaning (x200 resources, starting kits that include guns from first spawn and other mechanics that ruin survival gameplay)

English speaking Vanilla Non official servers do exist but they have 2 to 4 players active and are usually very high ping.

If you are Russian or Polish, there are many great vanilla non official servers with players on, might be a good purchase for you, otherwise your better off just buying a CS or another game that is what Hurtworld is becoming in the non official server side.

Or play the official server and get your 16+ base stolen by a person who can glitch in and authorize themselves in your land and have aimbot on in case you try to fight back, with 0 help from admins/devs.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

INTRO Hurtworld is similar to the other open world survival games on the market, but in it's own unique way is completley different.

PROS - Survival aspect is just hard enough without punishing new players
- PvP in the newby areas is mainly consistant of bow & arrows and spears while gun pvp is mainly found in the higher leveled areas
- When you die you keep your items, this means that there isnt a constant grind every time you die

CONS - Its Early Access so there are bugs
- People are just as unfriendly as ever and are willing to KOS you for no reason (although this is more a point for all survival games not just this one)
- The hypothermia system is pretty hardcore
- There isn't any way to lock your door so logging off with all your goods inside can be really dangerous

CONCLUSION All in all Hurtworld is a pretty well paced, enjoyable survival game. Unlike some other games on the market *cough* *cough* rust, the game doesn't heavily favour groups and punish solo players, its also a lot more forgiving in its survival mechanics but they can still kill you if you dont manage your warmth and food supply well enough. I'd say its worth the $19.99 asking price as the devs seem dedicated to actually fleshing this out into a full game unlike other developers *cough* *cough* DayZ.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game started out great, and in fact is still a fun game however there is a major problem with it...

Official server is plagued by cheaters/glitchers meaning that all your hardwork put into building bases and crafting items (which sometimes can take days since building requires an almost unnecesary amount of resources) are in risk of being taken from you without giving you a chance to fight back. The developers will not aid you if this happens and you are just S.O.L.

Non official servers do have more active admins, however if you are an english speaking player in america you will only find servers (with players) that get away from the intended gameplay meaning (x200 resources, starting kits that include guns from first spawn and other mechanics that ruin survival gameplay)

English speaking Vanilla Non official servers do exist but they have 2 to 4 players active and are usually very high ping.

If you are Russian or Polish, there are many great vanilla non official servers with players on, might be a good purchase for you, otherwise your better off just buying a CS or another game that is what Hurtworld is becoming in the non official server side.

Or play the official server and get your 16+ base stolen by a person who can glitch in and authorize themselves in your land and have aimbot on in case you try to fight back, with 0 help from admins/devs.

Check their FB page before purchasing, you will see that they have 0 contact with players. their support will never respond to you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If your looking for a game similar to early rust, with an emphasis on building, teamwork and trading, this is the game for you.
The development of the game so far has been very steady and well done.
Very little to no bugs.
Friendly and helpfull community.
The deveopers seem to have implemented a very interesting way to make people think twice about killing other players. with their Infamy system, it appears as if you lose more items upon death, the more people you kill.

All in all, this is an excellent game with some great never before seen features and a promising development.
9/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Edit: After 18 Hours of Playtime.

What can I say about this new gem that has been brought upon us? Hurtworld is going to stay true to its name, this game will hurt you. After playing roughly 18 hours in one session I feel I am capable enough of giving a fair review after what I have experienced.

PROS:

The Progression System" feels authentic. There's no fast tracking way to reaching the maximum potential right now. Everyone is capable of obtaining the same items no matter if you're a solo player or a group player
date:
but obviously groups are superior on this.

Crafting: The crafting system is easy to learn and with the items you receive/upgrade the benefits are shown easily.

Vehicles: Having vehicles are a luxury and are not in any means easy to come across. The driving inputs are a little awkward and your car may get jammed randomly in objects but they are possible to unbudge and continue.

Combat is fair and brutal: If someone gets the jump on you first
recommended:
chances are you may go down unless your skills can suffice.

Tools/Essentials kept on death: This is the only Non-Hardcore part I've found about hurtworld. Tools such as Hatchets/Bows/Guns/Pickaxes etc are kept upon death as long as they're binded to your toolbar.

One last thing before we get to the Cons. SLEEPERS AREN'T IN THIS GAME! I've been stressing it since Rust about this issue. Having sleepers in a survival game kills the Solo/Duo community. People have lives
hoursPlayed: jobs
voteText: children and families
helpfulPercent:
There is no way you as a Solo player are going to be able to establish yourself if there's no way of guaranting progress after you log off because some naked with a spear finds your body out in the wild. Thank you for removing this toxic mechanic.

CONS:

Hunger meter: Food is hard to come by even while hunting it seems like you're always hungry and need a bulk of food at all times.

Day/Night cycles: Day and Night together run by too fast when playing
votesHelpful: feels like you are getting prepared to go on a journey and right when you are about to leave it's nightfall.\n\nYou will not build a base quick
votesTotal: It's difficult to especially as a solo player to establish yourself within your first session (2-4 hours) Luckily whatever's in your posession on logout will be retained due to having no Sleepers.\n\nPopulation Cap: Personally I believe it's still too low and should be increased to 100/200 per server
votesFunny: but this game's still new and chances will continue to be made.\n\nAt the end of all of this
commentsCount: Do I recommend this game? Personally if you're a fan of survival titles and are sick of looking for your perfect match this is the perfect survival title in my opinion. It has every gritty aspect of grinding about in hopes of surviving every day. It's easy to catch on at the start and will keep beating you into the ground every minute you're playing. Even once you are comfortable with your living
column16: you can go outside and get speared down by several players for your loot within seconds.\n\n9.5/10"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I highly recommend this game for anyone who's looking for a pretty cool survival game to play.
Most people compare survival games to what Rust is doing, but let me tell you, this game --imo-- is 100x better and let me state just a few reasons why:

Let me first clarify that all of these comparisons that I am making are to Rust, I'm not comparing this to any other survival game. Just to be clear. This is also just a very basic review, if anyone would like me to do a full detailed review, I can. Just comment or PM me.
voteText: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hurtworld is a game which does Early Access right! It's very stable and well optimized and has a lot of content in it already which others games are lacking, especially on their first day of release.

I've been put off buying anymore EA games due to how most of them have turned out, but having already seen the positive reviews and a look at videos, I thought that surely one of these games has to be good right? I think Hurtworld may just be it.

Sure it needs improvements, but its Early Access and I am confident the developers will make this great. They already communicate exceptionally well for a developer and it has all the makings to be an awesome game and one of the stand-out survival games. Oh and there are no zombies in sight!

It is similar to Legacy Rust in a lot of ways, but in my opinion is better overall. It also has similarities to The Long Dark so if you are a fan of survival games, particularly the latter, then you'll enjoy Hurtworld.

I think it's kind of mixed review.
At this state you could play and enjoy, but not too much.

Pros:

Cons:
- 3rd person can't use some items (grill or workbench for example) while standing, need to crouch, also crosshair is moved compared to 1st person and you keep missing.
- Running and seeing nothing (stay for 10-20 seconds on one spot and you'll see bunch of resources you can't saw before)
- Murder system (two people attacking you, you kill one and you flagged, second kill you and you lost your item, but you just defending)
- Not too much crafting and nothing new to reveal (all you can craft is in workbench)
- Hard to obtain wheels for cars (found 0 wheels after 25hrs) and c4.

It's in EA so i think game have potential

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pro's- The first thing that struck me when I first spawned in this World was the atmosphere I love the type of Mad Max Fallout 3 & 4 look which really looks Badass. The Graphics are spot on for a very early alpha, could use an update in the future when it is near done. The gameplay is as you would expect from an survival game you have your hatchet, to break down and collect wood and other materials. Your spear which is really awesome to have, to hunt animals such as Boars, Deer looking things and bunnies. Then you got your guns, you HAVE to craft your guns. You can't find them. You have your Shotgun one shot close up, your Bolt-Action Rifle long range sniper type weapon, then you got your Assault Rifle COD in a nutshell which is not bad to fend off raiders. Last but not least your base building which requires a lot of gathering and patchiness to make a whole base, it took me about 5 hours to build mine. It's quite fun and basic.

Con's- In the beginning start out with half hunger, I praised for this tactic to not be used in any other survival game such as in “DayZ” where you start out hungry please don't, but food is easy to find there's that. Spawn place in one general location easy to die from new players or experienced players out there. There should be ways to get into people's doors, maybe a pick lock in a later update? You die very quickly from hypothermia or heatstroke depending where you are in the map. Yeti's are too hard to find and unless you have friends almost impossible to kill without a gun.

8.5/10 Would get raided and killed again

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Should I buy Hurtworld? DEPENDS. The game is AWESOME, actually is one of the best survival games i've played. Devs keep updating it. However, people always forget what is the concept of an EARLY ACCESS game. The game is changing, almost every patch. There is always something new, something removed, something fixed, new bugs, bugs fixed and of course ... THERE WILL BE WIPES. If you keep that in mind, you'll discover that Hurtworld is what every alpha game should be: updated.

The game is amazing, if you jump into it for the first time, you'll see some similarity to other survival games, and if you keep playing you will discover new things every time. The first time I entered a biome, I was like WTF dude, i'm freezing. Few minutes later I managed to build a fire and another player came with his hands up, asking if he could join me. Nice communication, without kos. Then we found an Yeti.........awesome creature. Such fur. Much horns. Damn i'm dead.
Pve is real, and it's dangerous. Also rewarding.

If you like survival and know what is an early access game. Just buy it, you wont regret it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Started as a fun little game where you run around bashing people's faces in with hatchets.
After a while, some of my friends and I decided to make a base.
Then we all grinded resources for a couple of days for guns and parts to make a car.
We got guns.
We made a car.
Found a guy named Dr. Dre, who had many slaves, and captured everyone who joined the server and made them work for him.
We raided him and killed tons and tons of his servants.
Then my friend killed him with a bolt action.
An epic battle occurred where we killed tons upon tons of little slave people and Dr. Dre until we finally died.
Then we got bored.
So, we drove around in our car and took all of our guns and just ran around killing everyone on sight.
Eventually we died and we just left the server.

TL:DR: Spent a week getting resources with my friends to make guns and a car, then wasted it all.

10/10, would grind resources again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game with extremely frequent updates + devblogs to keep you in the loop. Community is mildly friendly with the occasional d-bag here and there. Often if you claim you're friendly you're usually left alone. Infamy system could use a bit more polishing but it has a great general idea, if you kill too many people you'll have a chance of dropping the gear you worked really hard for when you die, which means banditing is discouraged. There's lots of mobs, both dangerous and harmless, like the boar and acid-spitter (too lazy to pronounce their real names). Graphics are enjoyable and the animations are hardly clunky, think of it like a mix between borderlands and Team Fortress 2.

The map, overall, is pretty large. There isn't any procedural generation or other maps, but it's hard to get bored with a map of the scale this game has. There's plenty of biomes and the transition into them is pretty unique, it isn't just empty space either, there's landmarks, like the fortress, airfield, and aircraft carrier, which you can find loot crates at. Crafting is quite simple and far from complex, which is what makes it enjoyable and easy-to-use.

Overall I'd give this game an 8/10, just because, for now, it could use more polishing and meat on its bones in terms of content.

I really enjoy the building in this game and how you get a square" if you're able to claim it. But it still needs work. There isnt much in the way of customization for building bases.

My only issue is that the guns and vehicals have way too much of a DayZ vibe. Which i'm not a fan of.

PS: The environment will kill you. It's pretty hard to stay alive."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well , I gotta admin it was a huge surprise purchasing the game in Early Access and actually getting Game Stability and Optimisation . The game offers so much from the first 5 minutes in the game . There is no lag , no sudden DC or FPS drops . The crafting menu is so simple but elegant in the same time .

Something else that is a game changer is the fact that if you are being killed by a player you are gonna loose all your ammo and resources ( wood , stone , flint .. everything you picked up on the way ) but you are NOT gonna loose your weapons and gear ( shoes, pants , backpack .. ) that you allready crafted .

If you decide to go on a killing-spree be careful because you will get a level of  Infamy " which means that for 15 minutes if you die there is a chance of loosing your crafted weapons ( This was made to think twice before killing someone without having consequences ) .

The experience in the game is 10/10 . The game is only gonna become much better !

P.S. Be careful to build your base properly in the safe zone of a TOTEM . That way you will not join the game to realise your base is gonne :)"
