reviewText:
Early Access Review

Where do I begin with this game? Well to start as I am sure all of you know, this is a survival pvp MMO, very similar to Rust. However, this game is by far one of the most addicting games of all the ones I have played. This genre is the one I play most and I have logged more hours into a small amount of time then I have in any other game. 90 hours in 2 weeks... not bad.
Pros:
- Great PVP
- Great community
- Great crafting
- Beautiful scenery
- Make friends/enemies
- Runs smoothly most of the time
- Frequent patches and updates
- Huge amount of future plans
- For an Alpha, very polished
- Infamy system so you dont loose everything
- Wipe schedules so noone becomes too powerful on a server
- Lots of official and community servers

Cons:
- Rubber band lag alot
- FR drops occasionally

This is a game that anyone who is a fan of the genre should try, I would stray away from it if this is your first survival game as it is relativley challenging especially alone. But for $24.99 t is sure worth the price and I dont think any of you will regret the purchase.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I actually do reccomend this game but I suggest you wait a year or so if you like end game content in survival games.

Like most people I play survival games with a few friends. We usually catch on pretty quick having played most of the big titles. Sadly once you build a base and get all the guns/gear and car parts this game feels empty. I had a lot of fun for about a week playing because I had a server with an average of about 40 people. That number dropped to about 10 after the first week and every other server I have joined has died as well. There just isnt the content that a game like this needs to keep people active and playing.
I also feel like the devs are focused on some pretty useless stuff right now. After one month we are finally getting our first content update. What content you ask? We are getting giant mosquitoes and hand guns... While I have no issue with adding creatures and guns I can't help but feel like there is more important content to focus on at this time.
Again I had a lot of fun with this game but at this time wait for the game to add stuff to do.
Please check this games forum to verify what I am saying as well. A ton of threads currently are titled somewhere along the lines of Hurtworld is dead?!?!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I actually do reccomend this game but I suggest you wait a year or so if you like end game content in survival games.

Like most people I play survival games with a few friends. We usually catch on pretty quick having played most of the big titles. Sadly once you build a base and get all the guns/gear and car parts this game feels empty. I had a lot of fun for about a week playing because I had a server with an average of about 40 people. That number dropped to about 10 after the first week and every other server I have joined has died as well. There just isnt the content that a game like this needs to keep people active and playing.
I also feel like the devs are focused on some pretty useless stuff right now. After one month we are finally getting our first content update. What content you ask? We are getting giant mosquitoes and hand guns... While I have no issue with adding creatures and guns I can't help but feel like there is more important content to focus on at this time.
Again I had a lot of fun with this game but at this time wait for the game to add stuff to do.
Please check this games forum to verify what I am saying as well. A ton of threads currently are titled somewhere along the lines of Hurtworld is dead?!?!

Early Access Review

Starting out in a general server can be a bit... interesting. At first I wasn't a fan, but I've found that the community servers generally have nicer players who are more willing to help. That being said, a couple of my friends and I host our own private server, and it is a whole lot of fun. For new people, definitely look for emptier servers. The lack of competition will help a whole lot.

Good luck!!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI really thought this game would restore my faith in survival games but, once again, horribly disappointed. Can\'t even last a few hours in a server without being attacked by a group of hackers that clip into your structures and completely ruin the game. Everything else is fine I guess, but this single thing makes the game horrible! It doesn\'t matter how strategically you build or how carefully you choose your hideout. If hackers find you, they will attack you. And if you win, they will get revenge by casually walking into your home, taking ownership of it, and pretty much destroying the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ping is too high" granted even on league my ping is around 100ms....HOWEVER...u cant even play this game...I hope you have or get your own server however it would almost defeat the purpose...when I finally was able to play I found that the game had very loud and obnoxious sounds... music is peaceful and quiet which I do like. Certainly you COULD turn down the sounds in options but my gawd man the defaults should be close.

There was nothing to do...While roaming in the literall desert I was able to find nothing exciting...just one animal...the game isnt too hard to pick up on but has no tutorial in game...no single player and the animations and sound effects for EVERYTHING were poorly done....

Without a highly populated server that wont lag and you have friends to work/play with in this game....there is almost nothing here currently for you.

The game IS in early access...at this price point ($12 on humble bundle at the time) I still would stay away from this game for another year or two."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Why oh Why do I keep buying these types of games? Next time I do someone slap some sense into me.

So Day 1 I was invited to play with a popular streamer on twitch, we had both just got the game and had no clue what we were doing. After running about not being able to find each other for like an hour and dying to starvation over and over, we called it quits and had a fun time in 7 Days to Die.

But I was not willing to give up so I joined an official NA West Infinite server and started collecting resources - trying to build up and learn the game, I saw various semi naked people running around doing the same, they left me alone so I didnt bother them - after all we were all just learning the game.

I built my shack, got a few oranges planted and watched general chat while I was out collecting. I could tell from chat that this game was already like rust of the past - people abusing and killing each other but I thought lets see how far into the game I can progress - the answer came quickly in the form of a shotgun.

I was just laying my 1st foundation after a few hours had to watch a Youtube video to figure out you have to use a tool to do this and cant just add to your shack. I opened my door to be greeted by one [fap] member (yes he was really in a guild\clan called fap), who shotgun-ed me in the face, ran over me and stole all my stuff then proceded to kill my spawn point. He then camped me and killed me about 8 more times just to make sure I got the message then quickly wrote in chat - he attacked me?? I never knew before opening a door to my own shack was considered hostile. Why did noone tell me.

Now the game might be good - I liked what little I played, but as with these type of games unless you play on a private server you will never get anywhere! See Rust\Ark and the many more that came inbetween. And for this reason not only would I not recommend it but if I could refund this months Humble Bundle monthly I would as this game will live an die by its online community and its not for me.

Good Luck if you buy this on getting anywhere before you get fapped to death.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have had this game for quite awhile and it is a lot of fun to play, even for beginners.  The ability to build a base and acquire the necessary tools to do so is relatively easy.  There are some issues I have with the game though.  I prefer unmodded servers because you can get a better feel for the game.  However, you may not make it very far before someone kills and takes all your hard work away from you.  I do realize that this a game that is more PVP than anything, but I would suggest you play on a PVE modded server first before traversing to a server that is mainly PVP or the official servers.

As updates go, the wipes are few and far between which is good and bad at the same time.  Few updates means servers are rarely down, but it can cause a lot of excess clutter on some servers which can cause game issues such as lockups.  The mechanics of the game are pretty straight forward, collect, build, collect some more, build, etc.

The best part of this type of game is the ability to have vehicles.  Most servers only allow one vehicle per player which means you will have to choose between a car with 3-4 seats or a fourwheeler.  The only problem with the vehicles (at least on normal, unmodded servers is the lack of parts.  Most of the time players will receive bullets or paint when a vehicle is broken down or in loot crates.  It takes HOURs to find parts and cars only spawn about every 3 hours.

In closing, I would definitely buy this game now and play the heck out of it!  It is fun despite the few issues it has and the creators are working on updates as quickly as they can.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is by far the BEST early access game I have ever played.

I have tried just about every open world survival game steam has to offer. This game is well balanced and the community is excellent.

If your playing alone it could be difficult. You will get killed for your resources if you are an easy target, I played with a friend so I am having a excellent time. Most people seem to leave two guys alone. I've had several occasions where we traded resources to resolve our differences. Most people don't want to risk losing everything. If you play smart, you'll enjoy it.

Good
===========
+Excellent combat, it is actually more fun to shoot a bow then it looks! Melee combat isn't perfect but its the best I've seen in this type of game.
+Lots of official servers with good latency
+Gathering resources and picking up loot is quick and painless. No mind-numbing loading bars and inventory boxes. Just grab stuff, Smash rocks and stumps with 5 hits for bulk amounts of resources.
+Easy to pickup and play. You will have little to no difficulty getting the hang of things. You learn fast out of necessity.

Bad
===========
-The world feels a little empty at times, I would love to see more creatures and interesting landmarks.
-Occasional ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ kills you and grabs your stuff. You get to keep your tools so its easy to pick up where you left off.


If your considering buying this game its well worth the $30. Recently I bought Battlefront, Fallout 4 and Just Cause 3. I've never been so disappointed in my entire life. I'm done supporting the big game companies, they are just shoving ♥♥♥♥ down our throats. Kids will buy anything these days. Lets take things back to the basics.

Happy to support the game! Great work guys!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nGreat game. At the rate this game is going it will probably be one of my favorites. The main reason this game sticks out to me from dayz or rust is that it actually works. The servers and nearly every single part of the game seems to be working as intended which is amazing compared to other similar games. As of this post the game is a little over a year in development and is 2 days after being put up for early access on steam, and I'm already having an amazing amount of fun with all of the already fleshed out features. I can only imagine what's in store for this game if the devs don't abandon it like most early access games. Play it and refund it if you don't enjoy, because if you have half a brain you will see how the devs know what they're doing so the game is balanced so the most amount of people that can have fun will. I only don't suggest this game if to people who can't handle being killed or don't have thick skin. Other han a few bugs (which is expected from a game in early alpha) and the laughably bad voice acting, I highly suggest you play this game. The price to fun ratio is off the charts unless you're a whiny ♥♥♥♥♥ or obsess over graphics. Good job creators of Hurtworld.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Brought this game and seriously love the original rust feel to it.

However, it seriously isnt worth buying yet until the current freezes are fixed.

Combat freezes....you attack an animal..game freezes..you restart and find yourself dead.

Movement freezes...your game freezes and character ends up dead (usually for running into an animla or player.

Game is lacking content past the initial starting zone. Heading east,, north really offers very little in way of resources or things to do and see.

Game really lacks loot at the little towns where one would exspect to find loot.

Overall i think in due time this may end up being an ok game. However like most early release games its going to take time...and commitment from devs one they start getting payed :)

Early Access Review

I'm aquainted with some of the dev team, so I'm biased to some degree.  Personally, I need to play with friends to have fun in survival games.  I'm generally not a fan of the genre, but I've been finding myself compelled to log in to sneak around and burgle people's owong fields.

If you are a fan of the genre and have a group of friends to play with, I'd say it's compulsory for you to give this a try.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What I expected: a hardcore realistic survival FPS that does not become trivial after estabilishing basic needs.

What I got: an easy, medium-paced, unoptimized, unrealistic survival FPS that becomes trivial after estabilishing basic needs.

4/10 would die from either hypothermia if you didn't place a campfire or from heatstroke if you did place a campfire again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you liked rust legacy and hate what rust has become, get this game. Wonderful team of developers and it's a lot of fun. The main thing that I hate about this game is the infamy system. It makes no sense.. It literally doesn't work. For example, I killed 2 outlaws with a shotgun, they dropped their pants and shoes. Didn't drop a gun. I had a tiny bit of infamy, they instantly respawn on their stake (you respawn with the ammo in your gun for some reason) then they killed me and I dropped my gun. PVP doesn't work in this game.

Don't be that guy that says something like omg there are full loot servers which you can play on if you dont like pvp then go there!!!". First of all
date:
It is so hard actually finding a decent full loot server with low ping. They have no admins and it lags way too much since there are buildings literally everywhere. That is if you are lucky enough to find a server with actual players.

The moment that this is fixed is the moment that I fully reccomend this game.

IF YOU DIDN'T KNOW WHAT THE INFAMY SYSTEM IS: It is basically a thing to seperate the outlaws from the regular players. When you die
hoursPlayed: guns or clothes. However
voteText: if you kill a player then you will gain infamy. You then have a bigger chance to drop said items.\n\nThey could easily change this
helpfulPercent: make it so that you drop guns and not other things upon death."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I very much enjoyed this game over the past two weeks (71 hours), and it's my disappointment in realizing I can no longer bring myself to play it that has bought me to write my first review!

The developers have designed an enjoyable game... ruined by hackers.  When you're forced to consider a can't beat 'em - join 'em" solution... it's time for you to go.  I remember buying one of those hint books for a game once
date: and how it completely ruined my enjoyment of an otherwise good game
recommended:
so question what pleasure remains here for the hackers?  What is it about fair play that frightens them so much?

The Good:
Stable early access
hoursPlayed: graphics
voteText: a simplicity shouding addictive play
helpfulPercent:
and enjoyable open-world construction.

The Bad:
Hacks that let you see people through mountians
votesHelpful: hacks that let you find hidden homes
votesTotal: hacks that let you run faster
votesFunny:
hacks that let you jump farther.

Bottomline:
If the developers ever figure out how to block the cheaters... I'd be back.
